events.name: Google I/O 2014 - Revisited
events.description:
This will be the first meeting of Google Developer Group (GDG) New Hampshire. We will discuss some of the major themes from Google I/O 2014 and work as a team to plan some of the details of our new community.﻿

LooseAgenda(){
6:30 - Mingle;
6:50 - Introduction by Organizer Ben Fortner;
6:55 - Member Annoucements/News;
7:00 - Google I/O Revisited, The Wearable Future, Ben Fortner;
7:15 - Discussion;
7:30 - Community Planning Session;
8:00 - Disperse;
}

***The venue has been changed to accomidate the smaller size of the meetup. Cozy and comfy were considered.

events.name: Designing for Tomorrow: Glass, Watches, Android TV
events.description:
Google is launching a number of new products that extend the user experience across multiple devices. Wearables have been an obvious trend but how will they work with devices in our home?

That's up to us to decide.

At this meeting, we will present Google Glass, ADT-1 (Android TV Developer Addition) and a watch of some sort running Android Wear. 

Come out and get hands on exposure to the newest Google products and mingle with your fellow developers. Let's eat, drink, and explore!

events.name: Google API Exploration: We will create the beginning
events.description:
How many API's does Google offer? What are they?

A hands on look into the world of developing with Google. Bring your computers and be ready to create! We will be working together to lay the foundations of gdgnh_lib.

You will leave saying, "I had no idea it's that easy!"

Thank you to MakeIt Labs for hosting us this week!

events.name: Google API Exploration: Maps and Android
events.description:
An exploration of two Google APIs, led by two members of our group. Bring your computers and be ready to create! 

6:30 - 6:45: Schmoozing

6:45 - 7:00: Introduction and Member Business, Ben Fortner

7:00 - 7:15: Introduction to Google Maps API, Franz Honer

7:15 - 7:30: Developing for Android, Doug Parsons

7:30 - 8:00: Hands On: Setting up Google Developer Console, Ben Fortner

8:00 - 8:30: Member discussion. Topic: The GDG New Hampshire toolkit, software, library

Franz Honer

Franz is an independent web specialist, that has been creating websites professionally for over 10 years. His services include website design, search engine optimization, internet marketing, custom software programming and e-commerce consulting for all types of businesses.

Doug Parsons, Co-Organizer

Software engineer with extensive experience in the full life-cycle development of successful products in a variety of fields including medical devices, medical web-enabled systems, and IT infrastructure. Focused on creating innovative products and strong technical solutions to achieve customer and business goals.

These APIs and others can be found on the Google Developers site:

      https://developers.google.com/apis-explorer/#p/

 Thank you to MakeIt Labs for hosting us, again.

**Bill Schongar's BigQuery is being rescheduled to January. More information to follow.**

events.name: Startup Series - Charting the Course
events.description:
The GDG New Hampshire Startup Series focuses on helping New Hampshire startups design, develop, distribute, and monetize their business. In the first installment, we will introduce the Google Developers Startup Launch Playbook and gain a better understanding of the development process and where to focus energy and resources.

We will get together at our new home, Alpha Loft, in Manchester, NH. Alpha Loft incubates and accelerates startup and early-stage companies in NH, creating an entrepreneurial culture of growing companies.

Snacks and refreshments will be provided.

Agenda

6:30 to 7:00 - Meet new friends and reconnect with old. Networking.

7:00 to 7:05 - Introduction by Ben Fortner

7:05 to 7:30 - Google Developers StartUp Launch Playbook 

7:30 to 8:00 - Solving Big Problems for New Hampshire - Guest Speakers TBA

8:00 to 8:30 - Discussion

events.name: Startup Series Design Sprint, Speaker Cory von Wallenstein
events.description:
We are excited to welcome one of our newest members, Cory von Wallenstein, to share his startup experiences and participate in the group discussion. This week we will also get hands on with the Design phase from the Google Developers Startup Launch Playbook by conducting a minified Design Sprint. 

"The sprint is a five-day process for answering critical business questions through design, prototyping, and testing ideas with customers. Developed at Google Ventures, it’s a “greatest hits” of business strategy, innovation, behavior science, design thinking, and more — packaged into a battle-tested process that any team can use."  - Google Ventures

Snacks and refreshments provided. Currently seeking a sponsor for food. Let us know if this is you!

About Cory

Cory von Wallenstein is the CEO at Adored, transforming customer loyalty and engagement.

Prior to founding Adored, Cory was the Chief Technologist and CTO at Dyn  the Internet Performance company headquartered in Manchester, NH powering more than 100 of the Alexa 1000 web sites (the 1000 largest web sites in the world). Over his six year tenure at Dyn, Cory led product, engineering, technical operations and evangelism, and helped scale the company to more than 400 global employees with offices in the US, UK and Australia.

Outside of Adored, Cory serves as an advisor to Dyn, Evergage, Carvoyant, JumpCloud and Marlin Mobile, and shares his expertise on product development, user experience, and scalable architecture on great publications like GigaOm, PandoDaily, Wired, and DevOps.com. He was the founding investor of Trendslide, a SaaS Business Intelligence company (acquired in 2013), as well as a founding investor in the NH TechOut $500k startup competition.

In the community, Cory serves on the Board of Trustees for the Mount Washington Observatory, and the Board of Advisors for the leadership development community Intelligent.ly, the Entrepreneurs Foundation of NH, and is a frequent mentor at TechStars Boston, the Harvard iLab, MIT and WPI. Cory lives in Bedford, NH with his wife Jessica and three children.

About Adored, http://adored.com

The Adored app for iOS and Android delivers kick-ass automated loyalty to the consumer, and a channel for real-time engagement for upsell and driving top of mind awareness to merchants and brands.

Adored is powered by iBeacon indoor location technology, enabling users to receive loyalty rewards and content just by walking in to their favorite places; they never have to take their phone out of their pocket. No account to create or login to; they just need the Adored app on their phone.

Based on the anonymous loyalty behavior profile, Adored tailors the product experience delivering promotions and incentives, introductions to new great brands and places, and compelling content to strengthen the relationship, make the experience more memorable, and drive top of mind awareness.

About Alpha Loft, http://alphaloft.org

Alpha Loft incubates and accelerates startup and early-stage companies in NH, creating an entrepreneurial culture of growing companies.With multiple coworking locations Alpha Loft provides high value programming, events, advice, and mentoring, improving entrepreneurs prospects for successfully launching and scaling innovation-based businesses.

events.name: Intro to Google Cardboard (VR Headset)
events.description:
Get a hands-on introduction to Google Cardboard, a VR headset you can make yourself and use with your own smartphone. Try it on, try it out, and optionally stay for the second half of the session to learn to code for it. Did we mention we’ll be giving a few away as well?

Join us on Tuesday, October 13th from 6:00 to 8:00 pm at AlphaLoft in Manchester (http://alphaloft.org, 844 Elm St, Manchester, NH 03101) for a two-part session on Google Cardboard:

6:00:  Pizza and networking

6:15:  Part 1 - Introduction, Overview and hands-on playtime (45 mins)

7:00  Break for snacks and setup

7:15  Part 2 - Coding Intro. Create a simple Google Cardboard app (45 mins)

Presenters: Bill Schongar, Sarfraz Ahmad

Pizza provided thanks to Sunrise Labs of Auburn, NH.

During Part 1 we’ll give you the “What” and “Why” of Cardboard, and give you a chance to try out some of the existing Cardboard apps out there. Have an Android smartphone? Bring it and see how your own phone and choice of app works.

At the end of Part 1 we’ll be giving away two pair of Cardboard goggles, drawn randomly from names in a hat. Don’t worry if you don’t win; we’ll tell you how to make or (inexpensively) buy your own pair.

During Part 2, for anyone who’s interested,  we’ll run through a quick and dirty coding session to create a sample Cardboard app. This is designed as an extremely basic introduction to developing for Android and specifically for Cardboard, and to participate you’ll need the following:

Your own laptop with Android Studio (free) already installed

Get it here: https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html

A basic familiarity with Java

Note: This session is specific to developing an app for Cardboard, and it’s not intended to substitute for a ground-up Android development workshop. If you’d like us to hold one of those in the future, let us know!

At the end of Part 2 we’ll be giving away another 2 pair of Cardboard goggles just for people who participate in the coding session.

events.name: Getting started with Google Analytics on Android
events.description:
Learn how to use Google Analytics technology with an Android App in order to measure user engagement, App usage analysis, eCommerce measurement and custom event reporting.  

Join us on Tuesday, November 3rd from 6:00 to 7:30 pm at Alpha Loft in Manchester (http://alphaloft.org, 844 Elm St, Manchester, NH 03101)

Presenter:  Sarfraz Ahmad

6:00:  Pizza and networking

6:30:  Presentation - A high-level introduction to using Google Analytics to gain insights into adoption and use of an Android app. Find out how to improve user experiences and help your app succeed -- instead of being deleted or abandoned.

7:00:  Informal discussions on Google-related topics of interest to the attendees as well as suggestions for future topics and events. Let’s hear your ideas! Android code labs, Google Cloud Platform, and AngularJS are a few that we’re already exploring for upcoming events. 

Optional: Bring your laptop and we’ll set you up with Android Studio to give you a head start.

About the Presenter:

Sarfraz has over 11 years of experience working in software development with last 4 years as an Android developer. He has created many social and communication Apps for leading Telecom operators and currently working in the medical domain.

Pizza provided thanks to Sunrise Labs of Auburn, NH.

events.name: Multi-Platform App Development in Half The Time
events.description:
Explore different ways of creating your mobile application for Android and beyond. We’ll look at the Android IDE, Xamarin and Ionic as differing IDEs for creating your application, providing some insights into the pros and cons of each approach.

Trying to code your first app? See how to create a “Hello World” mobile app in 5 minutes. Wondering about Native vs non-Native performance?  Options abound. Java vs Objective C vs Swift got you down? See how cross-platform saves the day.

Bring your laptops if you’d like to, as there will even be some time for some basic guided hands-on exploration after the discussions. You may walk in with an idea, and out with a skeleton of your app already running.

Join us on Tuesday, December 8th from 6:00 to 8:00 pm at AlphaLoft in Manchester (http://alphaloft.org, 844 Elm St, Manchester, NH 03101)

Get there early for pizza, graciously provided by Sunrise Labs.

Presenters: Bill Schongar, Sarfraz Ahmad

 6:00 to 6:30 pizza and networking.

 6:30 Sarfraz:  Native Development - Android IDE (Java)

 6:50  Bill - Cross-platform Development - Ionic (for HTML5)

 7:10 Sarfraz - Native Cross-platform Development - Xamarin (C#)

 7:30-8 Open Discussions and Hands-on (BYOD)

events.name: Android Study Jam: Course Preview
events.description:
Get ready to build your first Android apps! Come for a preview of our Android Study Jam series which will start in mid-March.  We'll have informal Q&A, clips from the recent webcast by the Google and Udacity online course instructors, networking, and pizza.

Who is this Study Jam series designed for? 

The Study Jams for Android for Beginners is best suited for two audiences: 

1) those new to programming 

2) those with programming experience who have never used Android.

Newbies, students, and experienced programmers new to Android can all benefit from this course. The Study Jam will follow the Udacity "Android for Beginners" course, and is offered exclusively to GDGs.

What do students get?

Personal tutoring on the course material

Community setting to support course learning

Swag pack

Food

Google-offered Study Jams completion certificate

Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion

Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality

This event is a preview!  No laptop or Android device needed.

Please fill out our Android Study Jam planning survey if you haven't already:

Study Jam Dates for GDGNH are TBD starting in mid-March.  We'd like to learn what works best for the most people:

       https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/C6QKPHB

Don't have an Android phone or tablet for the series? 

No problem! You can still join the mid-March Study Jam series by using the Android simulators built into the free tool, Android Studio.

Already beyond beginner at Android? 

Take the course anyway and come help your community as a peer tutor.

Pizza for the event is sponsored by Sunrise Labs.

#gdg #studyjam #android #devstudyjam #gdgnh #mht #nh

events.name: Android Study Jam (for Beginners) -- Week 1
events.description:
Get ready to build your first Android app!  The Android for Beginners study jam series is starting on March 21st at 6 pm at UNH Manchester, room P101.  This study group is best suited for two audiences:

1) those new to programming 

2) those with programming experience who have never programmed for Android.

This year's Study Jam is custom-designed by Udacity and Google for those of you who are looking to break into mobile app development as a beginner, and does not assume any prior development experience.  

First, RSVP to the Meetup. Second, click this link to signup for the Udacity course (Android Development for Beginners):

http://goo.gl/forms/WhlKJNVzqO

The online course will be facilitated by several experienced developers including, Sarfraz Ahmad, Bill Schongar, Daniel Pinard, and others. We'll get you started with the online course at the first event along with additional live material to help you succeed and have fun.  

The Study Jam Android course will run over 5 weeks with 3 live sessions on Monday nights (3/21, 3/28, and 4/4), a one-week break to work on your own (with online facilitator help), and then a final live session on Monday, 4/18.

We'd love to see many of you out there, so come hang out with your local development community and add some new skills to the repertoire.  

Pizza will be served at 6 pm.

What Students Get: Personal tutoring on the course material. Community setting to support course learning. Swag pack. Food. Google-offered Study Jams completion certificate. Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion. Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality

Course Prerequisites and Requirements 

"If you are new to programming and don’t know where to start, then this is the course for you!

We will use Android Studio to build our apps, so you should have access to a computer that can run Android Studio in order to follow along (see Android Studio’s System Requirements for details). Don’t worry, you do not need to install Android Studio in advance – we will provide detailed installation instructions as part of the course.

Access to an Android device is helpful, but not at all required.

Now, in case you have some programming experience, parts of this course may be too slow for you — you should feel free to skip those sections.

Finally, the most important prerequisite is a willingness to learn new things, and belief that you can do this!

See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity."

Please bring

A computer that satisfies these system requirements

A computer charger

Android device (optional, you can use an Android emulator if needed)

USB cable to connect the device to their computer

Headphones (to watch videos in the classroom)

You DO NOT need to install anything in advance! =)

#gdg #studyjam #android #devstudyjam #gdgnh #mht #nh

events.name: Android Study Jam (for Beginners) -- Week 2
events.description:
Fun with Android continues, with Session 2 of the Android for Beginners Study Jam series March 28 , 6pm at UNH Manchester, room P101. 

Did you miss the Session 1 on March 21? Don't worry! This series uses online course material, so we can tell you how in just over two hours of on-your-own prep work you can be caught up with the rest of the group and ready to go!

This study group is best suited for two audiences:

1) those new to programming 

2) those with programming experience who have never programmed for Android.

events.name: Android Study Jam (for Beginners) -- Week 3
events.description:
Fun with Android continues, with Session 3 of the Android for Beginners Study Jam series April 4th , 6pm at UNH Manchester, room P101. 

Did you miss the Session 1 on March 21 and/or Session 2 on March 28? There still may be time to catch up and attend... there's about 4 hours of online course material to cover and some installation of software..

This study group is best suited for two audiences:

1) those new to programming 

2) those with programming experience who have never programmed for Android.

This year's Study Jam is custom-designed by Udacity and Google for those of you who are looking to break into mobile app development as a beginner, and does not assume any prior development experience.

http://goo.gl/forms/WhlKJNVzqO

We'd love to see many of you out there, so come hang out with your local development community and add some new skills to the repertoire.  

Pizza will be served at 6 pm, sponsored by Sunrise Labs.

What Students Get: Personal tutoring on the course material. Community setting to support course learning. Swag pack. Food. Google-offered Study Jams completion certificate. Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion. Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality

Course Prerequisites and Requirements 

If you are new to programming and don’t know where to start, then this is the course for you!

Please note: There have been several issues with wireless at UNH in this room, especially on devices with Windows 10 and McAfee. We're looking into it...

events.name: Android Study Jam - Week 4 - Online Help Jam
events.description:
Welcome to Week 4! This week is our **Virtual Only** meetup - we have a Webex session (below) so you can call in from home, the road, wherever you are.

No matter where you are in the course, feel free to join us and ask any questions. We'll be covering:

- Week 3 in Review

- Some advanced topics folks have asked about, including adding a Database (SQLite) to an application

- Questions you may have on developing your app

- Notes for the Final session April 18

- Other questions!

To attend, see the Members-only meeting location for Webex details.

events.name: Android Study Jam (for Beginners) -- Final Session!
events.description:
Join us for the final session!

The Android for Beginners study jam series is wrapping up on April 18 at UNH Manchester, and it's time to celebrate. We invite all of our our Study Jam participants to join us at UNH Manchester from 6-9pm and share your experience, show off your app if you have one, and just have a good time.

For people who attend and have attended previous sessions there will be:

• Some fun freebies

• Automatic entry into a raffle for a chance to visit Google's office in Cambridge

• Food

• A chance to show off your app if you want to, whatever state it's in

• Completion certificates (once your app is done, see below..)

Remember, your app does not have to be done to come to this session. Once it's done you'll get your completion certificate and Android Nanodegree discount code, but no matter what state it's in please come and share your experiences and thoughts with your classmates. Remember that even after this session help will still be available, don't worry!

For everyone there will be:

• Pizza and Soft Drinks (sponsored by TEKsystems)

• Socialization

• A chance to see what people have done with their apps 

So join us for a time to hang out, make contacts, and maybe even find some teammates to take your app to the next level!

#gdg #studyjam #android #devstudyjam #gdgnh #mht #nh

events.name: Field Trip to Google I/O Extended at Google Cambridge
events.description:
BY INVITE ONLY:  
GDGNH Field Trip to Google I/O Extended event at Google in Cambridge, MA. THIS WAIT LIST is CLOSED. No tickets available. See Medford event, instead.

Our group received a limited number of tickets to this private event at Google's Kendall Sq location. The tickets have *already* been given out* to GDGNH members via a raffle to attendees at our last Android Study Jam event on April 18th.

Ticket holders already have their confirmation emails from Google. If you don't have that confirmation from Google then you're not going. Sorry!  The waiting list did not get tickets.

Google I/O is a yearly event where Google announces products, plans, and technologies for the coming year.

You can learn more about Google I/O 2016 and follow along with main I/O event in Mountain View, CA via this link: 

       https://events.google.com/io2016/ 

Some events should be streamed live or later.

ATTEND THE MEDFORD EVENT, INSTEAD:
Since our waiting list is closed you might be interested in another "local" Google I/O Extended event at Agero in Medford, MA.  They'll be showing the live stream from I/O in Mountain View, CA for all three days (May 18th-20th), supplying snacks & drinks, and raffling off Chromebooks.  

Here's the signup link on eventbright.  As of early 5/17/16, there were plenty of spots left. Pick your day(s):

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/io-extended-2016-agero-boston-tickets-25141958274

events.name: AskFirebase: ONLINE Hangout with Firebase creators.  Back-end-as-a-service.
events.description:
ONLINE Google Hangout with the Firebase (back-end-as-a-service) Co-Founder & Firebase Dev Advocate. Learn to easily build back-ends for your mobile apps. 

*** ONLINE event from GDG North America at Google in CA. ***

The (new) Firebase platform and features were one of the bigger stories coming out of Google I/O 2016. This is seen as the year that Firebase really reinvented itself to go beyond being a real-time database, to becoming a comprehensive back-end-as-a-service solution for anyone building mobile or web apps.

If you are a front-end designer, app developer, or tech enthusiast, you won't want to miss this!!

REGISTER FOR THE EVENT HERE: https://events.withgoogle.com/post-io-event-live-hangout/

THEN: 

Go to bit.ly/watchhangouthere to watch the live stream on May 26 at 6:00pm EDT.

Submit your questions now on Google+ or on Twitter using the hashtag #AskFirebaseLive.

*** This is an ONLINE event from Google In CA. ***

Watch it live or later on replay.  

NOTE: Many of us will watch it, later, since we'll be at Dyn for the Alpha Loft's yearly big "Startup Shindig" event, on Thursday.  Buy tickets to that, here:
     https://www.eventbrite.com/e/accelerate-nh-demo-day-startup-shindig-tickets-22508238748
events.how_to_find_us: Stay home and watch. This is an ONLINE event from Google In CA.

events.name: Android N Highlights
events.description:
What’s new in Android N? Join us for and informal discussion around the big changes and new capabilities coming in the Android N release.

Bring your android questions, ideas, and even a project if you’d like.

The second half of the meeting will be a planning session for the Fall. We’re looking for suggestions and feedback on topics for guest speakers and hands-on programming events. We have several events in the works including:

1. Augmented Reality (AR) taking you beyond Pokemon Go and Google Tango with new technologies coming in Android N to help build immersive AR.

2. Android as a platform for medical applications.

We want to hear from our community as we introduce some of these topics and build a lineup for the coming year. Here are a few possibilities. What else interests you?

• IoT - The Internet of Things (or Everything)
• Progressive Web Apps - They look native, load quickly, and add functionality on demand
• Firebase - Quickly build rich apps with synced back-end systems
• Machine Learning with Tensor Flow

Join us on Tuesday, August 9th from 6:00 to 7:30 pm at the Alpha Loft in Manchester (http://alphaloft.org, 844 Elm St, Manchester, NH 03101)

Get there early for pizza, graciously provided by TEKsystems

6:00 to 6:30 pizza and networking.

6:30 Discussion: What’s new in Android N.

7:00 Planning: Overview of possible topics. Suggestions and questions from attendees.

7:30 Done.

#gdg #gdgnh #android #mht #nh

events.name: Augment your world: Applying AR and VR
events.description:
Everywhere you look, AR and VR have been gaining ground. But what does it mean to you as a developer, or a business? What are some real-world things you can do - more than ride a VR roller coaster for fun?

Come join us at Alpha Loft in Manchester on Tuesday, October 25th at 6:00 pm. Our guest speaker will be Steve Doroff. Steve’s startup, CDBG, works with organizations developing Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) solutions improving their current processes in the following areas: customer delivery, operations, product development and training.

Schedule:
 6:00: Pizza and networking. Thanks to sponsor, TEKSystems 
 6:30  Event start: What is AR/VR?

 6:45  Project Tango

 7:00  Project Daydream
 7:15   Intro to Unity with Daydream

 7:30  MIT VR Hackathon

 7:45  Q & A

 8:00  Done

In this meeting, Steve plans to show the work they are doing and where he has seen traction and then engage with meeting participants regarding what they are doing and how the technology might apply. The goal of this talk is about building the community and how you potentially could benefit from this technology as well.

Steve finds a big part of what he does is helping others to breakthrough their current notions of AR and VR and to gain a conceptual understanding of where the value is based on their own context. How do you do this? Through brief demonstrations of how the technology can be used and a lot of discussion.

Steve co-founded a software company that was later acquired by Oracle and in addition has worked with various companies providing technology services including: Gartner, KPMG, PriceWaterhouse Consulting and Andersen Consulting. Steve has an MBA from Duke University and a BS in Economics and Computer Science from Trinity College.

We’ll talk about the latest announcements from Google in the VR space, such as Google Daydream, and what it means for both developers, businesses and consumers in upcoming phone and headset hardware.

We’ll be giving away a Google Cardboard headset or two as well as a few sets of lenses for people wanting to build their own VR headset off other plans they may have found. So now is a great time to start thinking about how you’ll augment the world around you!

And, last but not least, we’ll talk about our most recent efforts and experiences at the MIT Media Lab AR/VR hackathon, the world’s largest to date where over 300 participates in 70 teams competed for over $20,000 in cash and product prizes…...interested in getting a peek at what other people like you have been doing in this fast emerging space?

events.name: Using Firebase to Build a Backend for Your Mobile App
events.description:
Got a great idea for a mobile app but need to build a scalable backend, quickly? Learn how Firebase can jump start your development using with a backend-as-a-service.

Join us at the Alpha Loft in Manchester on Tues Jan 10th:

6:00 - 6:30:   Pizza and Networking
6:30 - 6:45:   Udacity "Firebase In A Weekend" course overview
6:45 - 7:45:    2016 Firebase Dev Summit keynote video and discussion

Bill Schongar will introduce us to Firebase with a 

brief overview of the new (free) Udacity course, "Firebase In A Weekend", where you can quickly learn to build a real-time chat application in two days. 

https://www.udacity.com/course/firebase-in-a-weekend-by-google-android--ud0352

Next, we'll watch the keynote address from the 2016 Firebase Dev Summit and take questions along the way.

Learn about Google's Firebase platform at:
    https://firebase.google.com/

events.name: Android as a Future Medical Platform
events.description:
Could your next medical device run a smart OS? New health and fitness applications are becoming available for your Android phones and tablets every day. With the advent of modern UX, touch interfaces and smart devices, users are expecting their decades-old medical and health devices to catch up with technology as well. Today, when we see a display, we automatically want to interact with it using a touch interface and we expect the device to be smart, connected and aware.

Now, Android is being used in medical devices, providing a rich User Interface which might have traditionally been built as an embedded device from scratch. It is time-consuming to re-invent the wheel and build a rich UI, connectivity and security system from scratch.

Join us at the Alpha Loft in Manchester on Wed March 15th at 6 pm for a joint GDGNH and IEEE NH Computer Society event.  Our speaker is Sarfraz Ahmad.

Schedule:
6:00 - 6:30:  Pizza and Networking.
                        Thanks to our sponsor: Sunrise Labs.
6:30 - 6:40:  Introduction by Baris Kazar, IEEE Computer Society.
6:40 - 7:30:  Android as a Future Medical Platform - Sarfraz

In this tech talk we will look at “How Android as a platform helps in solving those problems and reducing complexity and time to market”. The learning from this event can also be applied to areas outside the regulated medical device world.

Sarfraz Ahmad is a software engineer with more than 12 years of experience in developing both Android applications and embedded devices for different verticals. For the past two years he has been developing software for medical devices, helping to blend technologies from other technology sectors into medical. Sarfraz will lead us through challenges and opportunities for building a medical device based on an Android hardware and software platform.

This is a joint event for Google Developers Group New Hampshire and the IEEE Computer Society, NH section.

events.name: Field Trip to Google I/O Extended 2017 at Google Cambridge (Invite Only)
events.description:
BY INVITE ONLY:  Field trip to Google I/O Extended event at Google in Cambridge, MA. See instructions, below.
*** 5/9/2017 update:
*** Ticket requests are now closed for this event. 

GDGNH has received a small number of tickets. This is an all-day event on Wed May 17, 2017.

Google I/O is the yearly multi-day festival in CA to roll out new Google technologies and plans. Regional I/O Extended events share some of this with local communities.

The May 17th MA event will have the Google I/O live Stream, talks by Cambridge based Googlers, great food and networking in the heart of Kendall Square.

If you're a GDGNH member and you want to go then please fill out the form (by 7 pm Mon 5/8) at this link:

              signup form

 You cannot RSVP to the Meetup invite.

If there's more interest than available tickets then the GDGNH organizers will prioritize requests based on GDGNH event participation, interests, and reasons for attending. Good luck.

We'll arrange car pooling for those selected.

events.name: Google I/O Recap: The Road Ahead
events.description:
What happened at Google I/O 2017? What’s new in Google tech?

Join us at the Alpha Loft in Manchester on Mon Aug 14th for a retrospective on the May 2017 Google I/O developers conference. Learn where Google technologies are headed.

Co-organizers Sarfraz Ahmad and Dan Konig will share their experiences from their first trip to the Mountain View, CA event in May. We’ll also have lightning talks on I/O topics and post-I/O rollouts.

6:00 - 6:30: Pizza and Networking. Thanks to sponsor:
Sunrise Labs (www.sunriselabs.com)

6:30 - 6:45: I/O Recap

6:45 - 7:00 Google I/O - On the ground: Sarfraz Ahmad and Dan Konig

7:00 - 7:40 Lightning talks on the latest Google technologies: Android, web apps, Machine Learning, TensorFlow, AR/VR, Google Home (demo), and others. Several speakers. 

7:40 -7:45 Interest survey for Fall GDGNH event topics. 

Have a requested topic? Or want to present a 5-minute talk on one? RSVP on Meetup and then post a message on the event’s message board.

events.name: Google Nearby - Discover the people and things around you (Nashua)
events.description:
Discover and exchange information with devices all around you, without having to be on the same network. Create fast, peer-to-peer connections for data exchanges, gaming, and more with Google Nearby. Enable contextual discovery for your apps and beacons. These are the kinds of things you can do with Google Nearby.

With the old Wifi Direct, Android Peer-to-Peer was a bit flaky. It could be made to work, but it wasn’t fun. Nearby takes the pain out of it, and adds in the ability to leverage Bluetooth, BLE and even ultrasonic communication between devices with the same APIs.

Join us at MakeIt Labs in Nashua on Mon Dec 4th at 6 pm:

6:00 - 6:30: Pizza and Networking. Thanks to sponsor:
                       Sunrise Labs
6:30 - 7:30: Google Nearby (Bill Schongar)
7:30 - 7:45: Tour of MakeIt Labs

This month we're in Nashua. To learn more:
http://www.makeitlabs.com/
http://www.makeitlabs.com/directions/
https://developers.google.com/nearby/

events.name: Google Cloud Platform Study Jam
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
10:30am: Coffee, Food and Networking
11:00pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
12:30pm: Lunch
1:00pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
2:00pm: Event ends

Thanks to Sunrise Labs for providing the space!
https://www.sunriselabs.com/

Free swag for attendees. We'll raffle a Google Daydream VR Headset!

• What to bring
Laptop (PC, Mac, Chromebook)

At the event we’ll use a tool called “Qwiklabs,” a Google training product. If you have used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up (creating an account is free). At the event we will give you a link that gives you one month of free Qwiklabs access.

Note: The # of attendees is initially limited but we we get people on the waiting list then we may still be able to get more GCP training accounts. We'll let you know.
events.how_to_find_us: There will be a sign on the door with a cell # to text in case no one downstairs to let you in.

events.name: Field Trip to Google I/O Extended 2018 @Google Cambridge (Invite Only)
events.description:
BY INVITE ONLY: Field trip to Google I/O Extended event at Google in Cambridge, MA. This is an all-day event on Tues May 8, 2018. Google I/O is the yearly 3-day festival in CA to roll out new Google technology and plans.

*** UPDATE ( 12pm 4/12/2018) : Applications are now closed. All 8 tickets have been issued. If you were selected you'll receive an email from GDGNH with further instructions. Thanks!
***

GDGNH received a few tickets to this private event at Google's Kendall Sq location on the first day of I/O. Regional I/O Extended events share some of this with local communities.

You must fill out the interest form, below, in order to have a chance.
(Don't RSVP on meetup. The RSVP wait list won't get you a chance to attend)

The May 8th MA event will have the Google I/O live Stream, a talks by Cambridge based Googlers, great food and networking in the heart of Kendall Square. This is a FREE event but attendance is by invitation, only.

If you're a GDGNH member and you want to go then please fill out the Google form (by 7 pm Sun Apr 22) at this link:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1XGG-thPpR4v1-WsEDn22fKMcaDD8G09NET5h9DVHg8s

If there's more interest than available tickets then the GDGNH organizers will prioritize requests based on GDGNH event participation, interests, and reasons for attending. You'll receive an email from GDGNH if you're selected. Good luck!

We'll arrange car pooling for those selected.

You can learn more about Google I/O 2018 and also follow along with main I/O event in Mountain View, CA via the link, below. Many sessions will be live streamed and available, later.

https://events.google.com/io2018/
events.how_to_find_us: If you have a ticket then you know what to do.

events.name: Bringing Augmented Reality to Android with ARCore
events.description:
ARCore brings augmented reality to Android at scale without any special hardware requirements. Learn the ARCore fundamentals of Motion Tracking, Environmental understanding and Light estimation. With ARCore, shape brand new experiences that seamlessly blend virtual content with the real world.

Join us at Jupiter Hall in Manchester on 7/19/2018 at 6:00 pm.

Guest speaker: Kunal Khona (AR and Android Developer at Wayfair).

Schedule:
6:00 Pizza and networking. Thanks to our sponsor, Sunrise Labs!
6:30 Event start: Speaker Intro by Steve Doroff
6:40 Bringing Augmented Reality to Android with ARCore (Kunal Khona)
7:25 Q&A
7:35 Networking and more AR demos from Kunal and Steve
8:00 Done. Special thanks to Jupiter Hall!

Kunal works with the Wayfair Next team to help create next generation experiences in AR. He has built AR experiences using Google Tango and ARCore and has been working on features like `View in Room 3D`, allowing users to easily try out furniture in their space.

Kunal was a featured speaker on ARCore at DroidCon Boston in March.

Learn how Wayfair and other leading companies are adding AR to their apps. Could your app or game be next?

*** Attendees are eligible for our free raffle of two Daydream View v1 VR headsets! ***

ARCore sample videos from Google (1:10):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttdPqly4OF8

AR is taking off in the real world:
https://techcrunch.com/2018/03/20/wayfairs-android-app-now-lets-you-shop-for-furniture-using-augmented-reality/

Sponsors:
Sunrise Labs https://www.sunriselabs.com
Jupiter Hall https://www.facebook.com/JupiterHallNH/

events.name: GDGNH Holiday Party: Arcade Night
events.description:
Join us for our end of year holiday party with food, desserts, and drinks at The Farm in Manchester, NH followed by your favorite old-school arcade games next door at the new old-school arcade bar, Electric Avenue Arcade.
No presentations. Just community socializing and fun.

Attendance is limited via RSVP to this meetup event.

This event is sponsored by Google (GDG North America). Dinner and games are covered. It's fine if you must arrive a little late since we'll be serving continuously.

Schedule:
6:00 - 7:30: (free) Dinner at The Farm Bar and Grille -- 1181 Elm St, Manchester.
7:30 - 9:00: Reserved arcade rental at Electric Avenue Arcade (cash bar).
http://www.electricavearcade.com/
Gift raffles, too.

The arcade will only be open for RSVP'd attendees to this Meetup event.
Please cancel your RSVP if you find your unable to attend. Thanks!

Parking: Your best bet could to to park behind the arcade near their backdoor along the edge of the Pearl St lot and walk to The Farm. Parking is free after 8.

(credit: edited photo based on one found on Electric Avenue Arcade's web site - and also painted on the wall at the arcade)
events.how_to_find_us: Ask to come to the function room at The Farm restaurant. We'll be there from 6 - 7:30 before we head over to Electric Avenue for arcade games!

events.name: Google Cloud - Study Jam 2019 - Bedford, NH
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our 2019 Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning. We'll choose our track(s) ahead of time based on interests of the people who RSVP for the event.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda:
10:30am: Coffee, Food and Networking
11:00pm: Qwiklabs session 1
12:30pm: Lunch (sponsored by Google)
1:00pm: Qwiklabs session 2
2:30pm: Event ends

Thanks to Sunrise Labs for providing the space!
https://www.sunriselabs.com/

We'll also have some raffle items.

At the event we’ll use a tool called “Qwiklabs,” a Google training product. If you have used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up (creating an account is free). At the event we will give you a link that gives you one month of free Qwiklabs access.

Note: GDG New Hampshire was renamed to GDG Manchester NH in Jan 2019 when GDG Portsmouth NH was started by current Manchester co-organizer, Dan Konig. The Portsmouth group serves the Seacoast including UNH Durham. The groups will sometimes work together.
events.how_to_find_us: There will be a sign on the door with a cell # to text in case we don't see you, first.

events.name: Droidcon Boston 2019 (Discounts)
events.description:
Droidcon is a global developer conference series and networking event focused on the best of Android. The idea behind Droidcon is to support the Android platform and create a strong network for developers and companies.

The 3rd edition of Droidcon Boston takes place from April 08-09, 2019 at the Calderwood Pavillion. Droidcon Boston 2018 had over 30 speakers presenting over 2 days, as well as birds of a feather sessions, four workshops, and a party!

Droidcon Boston is part of the global Droidcon community with over 20 Droidcons organized worldwide in 2018.

Find out more and buy tickets at:
https://www.droidcon-boston.com/

Current price today, 3/16/2019: $399 regular. $99 student.
*** This code is still working... for now: ***

Pi Day: 31.4% off :
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/droidcon-boston-2019-tickets-51797973132?discount=PI-DAY-2019

answers.question: What Google products are you most interested in learning about?
answers.answer: I'm very interested on Polymer but being that I work mostly in marketing at the moment I'd be interested in learning more about AdWords and Analytics API's

answers.question: What brought you to the group?
answers.answer: I was browsing for local Polymer groups and ran across this group.

group_profile.intro: I'm a web analyst uCool Inc. and an un-rehabilitatable technophobe always on the lookout for the next big thing to take for a whirl. With nearly 15 years in marketing in the tech industry I've manage to gather a little bit of knowledge along the way.

organizers.name: Doug P.
organizers.bio:
I'm a software developer currently working on medical products.   I live and work in Manchester, NH.

Skills include Java, C++, Python, C#, XML, SQL, & others. 
  http://www.linkedin.com/in/dougkparsons/

answers.question: What Google products are you most interested in learning about?
What brought you to the group?

group_profile.intro: Software developer in medical now getting into Android, IoT, and cloud.

organizers.name: Bill S.
organizers.bio: 10 fingers and 10 toes connected by a lot of craziness

answers.question: What Google products are you most interested in learning about?

group_profile.intro: Glass explorer by night. Big Data, Data Virtualization, SDN and Analytics guy by day.

answers.question: What Google products are you most interested in learning about?
What brought you to the group?

group_profile.intro: Mobile App developer. Worked on IM/messaging, VoIP and social Apps. Also worked in embedded software and medical domain. I had done a startup  focusing on vehicle tracking and security.Like startup culture and love discussing ideas and business plans

organizers.name: Barbara A.
organizers.bio: Currently Vice President of New Business Development at FuturePlus Systems.  I hold a BSEE/MSEE.   I love learning about new technology!  I belong to the IEEE and the Society of Women Engineers.  I am married, have 3 children and love to play TENNIS.

answers.question: What Google products are you most interested in learning about?
